meanings.sent1: There were gobs of candies in the jar.
meanings.sent2: She had gobs of fun at the party.
meanings.sent3: The kids found gobs of treasure in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: His generosity poured out in gobs of kindness.
meanings.sent5: The sky was filled with gobs of twinkling stars.

meanings.definition: A lump or mass, especially of something sticky or slimy
meanings.sent1: She stepped on a gob of chewing gum.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a gob of butter to the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The monster left a gob of slime on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The artist sculpted a gob of clay into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent5: A gob of jelly wobbled on the plate.

meanings.definition: To eat or consume greedily or voraciously
meanings.sent1: The hungry dog gobbled up his food in gobs.
meanings.sent2: She tends to gobble gobs of popcorn while watching movies.
meanings.sent3: He gobs down his dinner like he hasn't eaten in days.
meanings.sent4: The raccoon gobs up the berries from the bush.
meanings.sent5: The children gobs down the ice cream on a hot day.

meanings.definition: To talk or chatter incessantly or in a loud, aggressive manner
meanings.sent1: The parrot gobs away all day long.
meanings.sent2: She tends to gob gobs when she's excited.
meanings.sent3: The auctioneer gobs so fast you can barely keep up.
meanings.sent4: The politician gobs on and on during his speeches.
meanings.sent5: The gossiping neighbors gobs about everyone in the town.
